Description: Bowl and stem sherd of Attic, perhaps black-figured, pottery cup, probably type A; light groove at junction of bowl and stem; interior: part of black area around reserved tondo with dot and circle at centre; exterior reserved; glazed inside of stem; inscription on tondo.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 56, no. 106)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 704, no. 629)
Höckmann & Möller 2006 / The Hellenion at Naukratis: Questions and Observations (p. 14, fig. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0617) (Phase 1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens
